description: From Middle French cérémonieux, from Late Latin caerimoniosus, from Latin caerimonia.

adjectives.description: ceremonious (comparative more ceremonious, superlative most ceremonious)

entries.meaning: Fond of ceremony, ritual or strict etiquette; punctilious
examples: Ancient and oriental cultures are in many ways more conventional, more ceremonious, and more courteous than our own.

entries.meaning: Characterized by ceremony or rigid formality
